result.execSummary:
The defendant Wendy L. Thorbahn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant must obtain GED.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption of alcohol, no possession of alcohol & the defendant is not to enter upon the premises of any business that sells alcohol except to pay for necessities (gas, groceries).

Take all medications as prescribed by medical doctor.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA meeting per week and provide probation agent with proof of attendance.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count 1 except no additional community service.
Concurrent with: Count 1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wendy L. Thorbahn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Wendy L. Thorbahn in court with attorney Mary L Burns.  Charles J Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:50 PM. State - count 1 will be amended to 450.11(7)(h), fine of 300 plus costs, count 2 amend to 961.41 (3g)(d) with fine of $500 plus costs, plea G or NC with conditions of 2 years probation: AODA and follow through, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no entry into taverns or bars, must obtain full time employment or schooling, 200 hours community service, take all medications as prescribed by medical doctor, attend 1 AA/NA meeting per week with proof of attendance to probation agent. Thorbahn pleads guilty to count 1 & 2 as amended. Court goes through plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form and finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently has entered her plea. Court finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. State makes statement. Burns makes final argument, 6 days credit if revoked, asking for money to be released to her that was taken at time of arrest. State has no objection. Thorbahn withholds statement. Court considers statements of both parties. Court adopts the joint recommendation. State to secure money from FOSO from time of arrest and return to defendant, appeal rights. Court sentences defendant to the following: Count 1 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years: fine of $300.00 plus costs, AODA and follow through, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no entry into taverns or bars, must obtain full time employment or schooling (3/week), must obtain GED, 200 hours community service, take all medications as prescribed by medical doctor, attend at least one AA/NA meeting per week with proof of attendance to probation agent, DNA surcharge. Count 2 - $500 fine plus costs. Same conditions as count 1, no additional community service.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on June 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Wendy L. Thorbahn in court with attorney Mary L Burns.  Jodie L Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:13 am. Have agreement - state - Ct 1 DRI - Ct 2 plead as alleged - w/held probation 2 years - $500 plus costs - AODA and follow thru, sobriety, no possess/drugs/entry, edu/emp, 200 hrs community service, take all medications as prescribed, 1 AA/NA per week and provide written summary to probation agent each week. Court Ct 1 DRI - pleads G to Ct 2. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds that defendant is entering her plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently, factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges G of Count 2. State no objection to expunctio. Burns asking for expunction. Recess to figure something out as to defendant is to old for expunction. Recalled 12:22 pm. Burns wants to talk to District Atty Charles Simono. Bednar makes statement as no expunction in plea agreement and believes that DA Simono will not change the agreement at this point. Defendant does not qualify for expunction due to her age. Adj.
Final pre-trial on July 2, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on June 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Called at 4:02 PM. Wendy Thorbahn appears in person and with counsel Mary Burns. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. State - believe it will be a waiver. Thorbahn and Burns agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Burns has Information, waives reading, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, binds over, continues bond, set for FPT on 6/11/14 at 10:00 AM. Burns - gives correct address for defendant - asks about the money she had on her when arrested for stated reasons - asking Court to release that money. State - not aware of it. Court orders release of that money pursuant to 968.20 if not being held for other reasons (evidence). State - believes monies were derived for sale of narcotics. Court will not release money and Burns will file a motion in regards to that and will get it set for a hearing.
no consumption of alcohol, no entry into Miole Lake Casino, or Bingo Hall unless for employment

ADDRESS INFO for Wendy L. Thorbahn
Current: 11066 County Road M, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 04-23-2014)
Prior: 106 West Glen Street, Crandon, WI 54520
No consumption of alcohol and no entry into Mole Lake Casino or Bingo Hall unless for employment
Preliminary hearing on May 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 10:10 AM. Wendy Thorbahn appears via video from FOSO and her attorney Mary Burns appears in person. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns has complaint but has not had a chance to go over it with the defendant. Court reads charges and penalties. Burns waives further reading, asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons - states address is 11066 County Road M, Crandon, WI is address - does object to the no contact provision for stated reasons or for employment issues only. State - no objections but wants same conditions of no consumption of alcohol and no entry into Mole Lake Casino or Bingo Hall. Court amends bond to $3000.00 signature bond with conditions of: no consumption of alcohol and no entry into Mole Lake Casino or Bingo Hall unless for employment. Burns will waive time limits for PH. Court considers time limits waived, sets for PH on  5/7/14 at 3:00 PM.
No consumption of alcohol. Not to enter Mole Lake Casino
